nodes.title: II.2. Superficial structures: Primarily funerary superstructure
Site elements
nodes.body: The fragmentary nature of the SergamGser sgam superstructures precluded a detailed assessment of their ground plans. Not one enclosure has survived fully intact. The better-preserved, south half of the site consists of six interconnected enclosures in two rows of hree each. These six enclosures all share the same central wall. The east portion of the north half of the site appears to have supported three more analogous enclosures. These are now highly fragmentary. The west portion of he north half of SergamGser sgam may have contained a symmetrical array of three enclosures, but virtually all evidence of them has been effaced from the surface.
